main event: Multiple radar and visual sightings of unidentified flying objects near Nouasseur Air Base, French Morocco on March 6, 1954.
interesting points: Pilots from various aircraft reported stationary targets on radar at a distance of 3 to 6 miles., An Air Force Staff Sergeant reported observing a bright round object emitting a white light for approximately 10 minutes., The object reportedly accelerated and disappeared from view in about 5 seconds., Witnesses described the object as circular, about 100 to 150 feet in diameter, reflecting a bluish-white glow., Various accounts described multiple lights moving at high speeds, with one pilot observing an object brighter than stars.
witness description: USAF personnel, including pilots and ground control operators
